Anchorage.Conoco-Phillips Building: The Conoco-Phillips Building is a 22-story, 90.2 m (296 ft) office building begun in 1981 and completed in 1983 as the ARCO Building, at 700 G Street in downtown Anchorage, Alaska. It was designed by the Luckman Partnership of Los Angeles, in association with local architects Harold Wirum & Associates. It is the tallest building in the state, and with the nearby Robert B. Atwood Building, predominantly defines the center of the skyline of the city.
